programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of Saturday's Premier League games, with title contenders Arsenal and Manchester City in action. Arsenal hosted Leeds, while back-to-back champions Manchester City were at home to Liverpool, the team they took the title off two years ago. Other games included Chelsea v Aston Villa and Fulham's trip to relegation-threatened Bournemouth.

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures.

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Animal Park (7/20)
programme.desc: The keepers battle tirelessly to save the life of a reindeer calf who is just hours old.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (34/60)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Bourne, Walsall and Troedyrhiw.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt S49
programme.desc: Eric Knowles oversees today's Bargain Hunt which comes from The National Botanic Garden of Wales in Carmarthen. Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper are guiding the reds and blues, who have three hundred pounds to spend on three items that will hopefully make them a profit at the auction in Cardiff. Eric also chats to ceramic artist Jonathan Cox, whose work is inspired by the Welsh countryside.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S21 (40/53)
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a married couple find their ideal rural property in Somerset.

programme.title: Peter et Elliott le dragon
programme.desc: Orphaned boy Pete lives in the forest with his best friend, a dragon called Elliot.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces all the goals and highlights from Sunday's two Premier League matches, including the clash between Newcastle United and Manchester United at St James' Park. It's a repeat of February's EFL Cup final, which Manchester United won 2-0 to give Erik ten Hag his first trophy in charge of the club, so the Magpies will be keen to avenge that Wembley defeat. The day's other game was between West Ham and Southampton and could prove pivotal in the race for Premier League survival. It's a match-up that has often provided goals, including last season when Saints travelled back to the south coast with a 3-2 victory.

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights from the Barclays Women's Super League as Arsenal host Manchester City, Chelsea travel to Aston Villa, while Manchester United visit Brighton. The other fixtures are Everton v Tottenham, Leicester v Reading and West Ham v Liverpool.
